    MatcherExternalCommandFromFile

    public abstract class MatcherExternal
extends MatcherURL
    Matcher for running external matchers (require the subclass to create a command to execute).

    • Method Detail

      • getRuntimeArgument

        private static String getRuntimeArgument(String argument)
        Returns a runtime argument of the java virtual maschine like -Xmx (which specifies java heap size) and not main program arguments. It is checked if the given argument(parameter) is contained in one of the arguments of the program. If this is the case, it is returned (the full argument like "-Xmx100G" when "xmx" is the parameter of this function).
        Parameters:
        argument - the runtime argument to check for (like "xmx")
        Returns:
        the full argument like "-Xmx100G" (empty string if no argument is found)

      • isUsingStdOut

        protected boolean isUsingStdOut()
        if set to true, all logging should go to stderr and the result of the process (url or alignment api format) should go to stdout. if set to false, all logging should go to stdout and the result of the process (url or alignment api format) should go to stderr.
        Returns:
        true, all logging should go to stderr and the result of the process (url or alignment api format) should go to stdout, false otherwise

      • getCommand

        protected abstract List<String> getCommand(URL source,
                                           URL target,
                                           URL inputAlignment)
                                    throws Exception
        The command which should be executed. For example new ArrayList(Arrays.asList("java", "-jar", "myjar.jar", source));.
        Parameters:
        source - Source URL
        target - Target URL
        inputAlignment - URL of input alignment.
        Returns:
        The command as a list of strings.
        Throws:
        Exception - Exception

      • closeAllStreams

        protected void closeAllStreams(Process p)

      • replaceString

        protected String replaceString(String s)
        Replaces a string with the following mapping:
        • "{File.separator}" with the os dependent file separator. On UNIX systems the value is '/'; on Microsoft Windows systems it is '\\'.
        • "{File.pathSeparator}" with the os dependent path separator. It is used to separate filenames in a sequence of files given as a path list. On UNIX systems, this character is ':'; on Microsoft Windows systems it is ';'.
        • "{xmx}" with the value xmx value the java process is started with (e.g. "{xmx}" is replaced with "-Xmx100G")
        • "{xms}" with the value xms value the java process is started with (e.g. "{xms}" is replaced with "-Xms10G")
        Parameters:
        s - the string which should be replaced.
        Returns:
        the replaced string

      • replaceString

        protected String replaceString(String s,
                               URL source,
                               URL target,
                               URL inputAlignment)
        Replaces a string with the following mapping:
        • "{File.separator}" with the os dependent file separator.On UNIX systems the value is '/'; on Microsoft Windows systems it is '\\'.
        • "{File.pathSeparator}" with the os dependent path separator.It is used to separate filenames in a sequence of files given as a path list.On UNIX systems, this character is ':'; on Microsoft Windows systems it is ';'.
        • "{xmx}" with the value xmx value the java process is started with (e.g. "{xmx}" is replaced with "-Xmx100G")
        • "{xms}" with the value xms value the java process is started with (e.g. "{xms}" is replaced with "-Xms10G")
        • "{source}" with the URL of the source ontology
        • "{target}" with the URL of the target ontology
        • "{inputAlignment}" with the URL of the source ontology
        Parameters:
        s - the string which should be replaced.
        source - the source URL - should not be null
        target - the target URL - should not be null
        inputAlignment - the input alignment URL - can be null
        Returns:
        the replaced string
